featured.text: From the late 1850s until his death in 1910, Winslow Homer produced a body of work distinguished by its thoughtful expression and its independence from artistic conventions.
Their unique style, as remarked by Karen Blixen, author of Out of Africa, “has grown from the inside, and is an expression of the race and its history.”
Although babies imitate the facial expressions they see, smiling isn’t just learned by imitation.
The expression “constantly on the move” in the passage refers to the fact that __________.

other.text: When you show the picture to your friends afterwards, they’ll be impressed by your pet’s loving expression.
You’ll get a different expression from your pet using this technique.
Depending on your pet’s mood, the picture will capture an interested, curious expression or possibly a look of annoyance, especially if you’ve awakened it from a nap.
Which of the following is NOT discussed in the passage? (A) Facial expressions. (B) Physical contact.
Totem poles are important expressions of specific Aboriginal cultures.
To catch a different expression of your pet. 56.
We need to feel the rhythm of the music, hear how it inspires us to move and learn our unique style of movement and expression.
Likewise, girls are better in their expression of feelings.

definition.en_def: The act of conveying thoughts, feelings, or ideas through words, gestures, or other forms.
definition.example: Her expression showed that she was very happy.
